taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species emeritus;

treatment.description: Resembling no. 75; canes, petioles and axis of flowering shoot glandless; leaves dull, soft-pubescent beneath; primocane-leaflets 5, oblong-oval or slightly obovate, acute, the terminal one about 6 cm. long and on a petiolule 1 cm. long; pedicels of corymbiform raceme minutely glandular; calyx glandular; petals 10-12 mm. long, about 4 mm. broad.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Dry open ground, w.-centr. N.B. Fl. late June, July.
